Day 3: Giovinazzo - Matera (75 km)
When you arrive for the first time in Matera, you do not believe your eyes. The city is a maze of zigzagging staircases, steep lanes,cave dwellings and tiny courtyards: it’s a magical and unique landscape in the world. Halfway between Calabria and Apulia, Matera is also known as the “City of stones"! For a truly unique experience and to avoid the heat, live Matera by night: the white stone turns to golden reflections, thanks to the city lights and it all becomes unreal, it is such a perfect combination of dramatic panorama and architectural beauty!


The most romantic thing to do in Matera is to book a hotel room in the Sassi.
Where to stay: https://bit.ly/471LIFZ
Aquatio Suite Hotel is a charming hotel sets into a tufa ridge in the city’s Sasso Caveoso district located in the heart of UNESCO’s Sassi World Heritage site and it also includes a wonderful spa with a swimming pool carved into the rock and a restaurant with an outdoor courtyard...simply magical!


What to do: Explore as much as possible without getting tired with this tour aboard an authentic Italian Ape Calessino (Tuk Tuk). Zip through the streets of the historic Sasso Caveoso neighborhood to admire the main churches and squares and snap photos of the famous cave houses and views of the surrounding valley.


Read more about Ape Tour Matera - Panoramic tour in ape calessino 👉 https://bit.ly/3rAqnDc
